intro: Hypericum jeongjocksanense, commonly known as the Jeongjocksan hypericum, is a flowering plant native to South Korea. It belongs to the genus Hypericum, which includes over 400 species of flowering plants known for their yellow or orange flowers. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
